article_title: Elevated river discharge enhances the immigration of juvenile catadromous and amphidromous fishes into temperate coastal rivers
lead_author_affiliation: Arthur Rylah Institute for Environmental Research
notes: Our study shows that higher magnitudes of river discharge were associated with increased catches of juvenile catadromous and amphidromous fishes. With a limited supply of environmental water, environmental flows used to enhance immigration of these fishes may be best targeted to maintain small amounts of immigration into freshwater populations in waterways or years when discharges are low and stable.
